intro: Erycibe glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-green erycibe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Erycibe glaucescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
